title: Carrier's New Abound Net Zero Management Solution Helps Building Portfolio Customers Reach Energy and ... - PR Newswire
summary: Carrier has launched Abound™ Net Zero Management, a new solution that allows building owners to measure and report on energy and carbon performance across their properties. This digitally-enabled system is designed to help organizations achieve environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals by providing real-time data tracking and reporting. It aims to support efforts in reducing greenhouse gas emissions in buildings, which are responsible for a significant portion of global emissions. The initiative aligns with Carrier's goal to help customers reduce their carbon footprint by more than 1 gigaton by 2030.
green_innovation: TRUE - This innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by offering a solution that helps reduce greenhouse gas emissions from buildings, enhancing energy efficiency and supporting the reduction of carbon footprints.
business_innovation: TRUE - Abound™ Net Zero Management represents an improved business process that significantly differs from previous offerings by providing advanced, data-driven insights for energy management.
green_product: FALSE - While it is associated with sustainability, Abound™ Net Zero Management is a service rather than a tangible product, which does not fit the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The Net Zero Management solution employs methods to track, report, and analyze energy usage, thus minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability through improved operational practices.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 236220 - Commercial and Institutional Building Construction, 541512 - Computer Systems Design Services, 541618 - Other Management Consulting Services, 611430 - Professional and Management Development Training
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not suggest misleading claims about the environmental benefits of the product; rather, it provides a transparent description of a legitimate solution aimed at helping organizations improve their sustainability efforts.

title: Sinopec Launches the World's Largest Green Hydrogen-Coal Chemical Project in Inner Mongolia - PR Newswire
summary: Sinopec has launched the Inner Mongolia Erdos Wind-Solar Green Hydrogen Project, which aims to produce 30,000 tons of green hydrogen and 240,000 tons of green oxygen annually by utilizing abundant solar and wind resources in the region. The project, which represents the world's largest in the green hydrogen coal-chemical field, intends to support carbon reduction initiatives and advance China's green energy goals with significant investments and expected reductions in carbon emissions. The project includes various technologies such as wind and photovoltaic power generation and hydrogen production through water electrolysis.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the project contributes to environmental sustainability by producing green hydrogen using renewable energy sources, thereby reducing carbon emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, because it introduces a new method of hydrogen production that significantly differs from previous processes and has been launched commercially.
green_product: TRUE, as green hydrogen produced by this project is designed to minimize environmental impact and supports the goals of reducing carbon emissions.
green_process: TRUE, because the project employs a method that minimizes environmental impact through the use of renewable energy for hydrogen production and incorporates sustainable technologies in its processes.
product_or_process: Inner Mongolia Erdos Wind-Solar Green Hydrogen Project
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 211120 - Crude Petroleum Extraction, 221118 - Other Electric Power Generation, 324110 - Petroleum Refineries, 325120 - Industrial Gas Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article accurately describes the project's initiatives and commitments towards sustainable energy production without misleading claims.
